column4: your right alt is technically AltGr in ubuntu ... you will need to learn to use xmodmap to remap those keys ... see here http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/karmic/man1/xmodmap.1.html
well, it's showing as ISO_Level3_Shift in xev. I was wondering if there was anything newer than xmodmap. guess not.
you could use system>preferences>Keyboard Shortcuts and remap the keys you need to make whatever function you need
that doesn't remap a key though, just assign it to a command.
